segment.source: Create, write, and read a file
segment.target: Create, write, and read a file

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Read and write a file using a **StorageFile** object.
segment.target: Read and write a file using a **StorageFile** object.

segment.source: Note Also see the File access sample.
segment.target: Note Also see the File access sample.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

source.pc: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

target.pc: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic.
segment.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic.

segment.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.
segment.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.

source.pc: Know how to get the file that you want to read from, write to, or both

target.pc: Know how to get the file that you want to read from, write to, or both

segment.source: You can learn how to get a file by using a file picker in Open files and folders with a picker.
segment.target: You can learn how to get a file by using a file picker in Open files and folders with a picker.

segment.source: Creating a file
segment.target: Creating a file

segment.source: Here's how to create a file in the app's local folder.
segment.target: Here's how to create a file in the app's local folder.

segment.source: If it already exists, we replace it.
segment.target: If it already exists, we replace it.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Writing to a file
segment.target: Writing to a file

segment.source: Here's how to write to a writable file on disk using the **StorageFile** class.
segment.target: Here's how to write to a writable file on disk using the **StorageFile** class.

segment.source: The common first step for each of the ways of writing to a file (unless you're writing to the file immediately after creating it) is to get the file with **StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**.
segment.target: The common first step for each of the ways of writing to a file (unless you're writing to the file immediately after creating it) is to get the file with **StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Write text to your file by calling the **WriteTextAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.
segment.target: Write text to your file by calling the **WriteTextAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

source.pc: Writing bytes to a file by using a buffer (2 steps)

target.pc: Writing bytes to a file by using a buffer (2 steps)

segment.source: First, call **ConvertStringToBinary** to get a buffer of the bytes (based on an arbitrary string) that you want to write to your file.
segment.target: First, call **ConvertStringToBinary** to get a buffer of the bytes (based on an arbitrary string) that you want to write to your file.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Then write the bytes from your buffer to your file by calling the **WriteBufferAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.
segment.target: Then write the bytes from your buffer to your file by calling the **WriteBufferAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

source.pc: Writing text to a file by using a stream (4 steps)

target.pc: Writing text to a file by using a stream (4 steps)

segment.source: First, open the file by calling the **StorageFile.OpenAsync** method.
segment.target: First, open the file by calling the **StorageFile.OpenAsync** method.

segment.source: It returns a stream of the file's content when the open operation completes.
segment.target: It returns a stream of the file's content when the open operation completes.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Next, get an output stream by calling the **GetOutputStreamAt** method from the stream.
segment.target: Next, get an output stream by calling the **GetOutputStreamAt** method from the stream.

segment.source: Put this in a using statement to manage the output stream's lifetime.
segment.target: Put this in a using statement to manage the output stream's lifetime.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Now add this code within the existing using statement to write to the output stream by creating a new **DataWriter** object and calling the **DataWriter.WriteString** method.
segment.target: Now add this code within the existing using statement to write to the output stream by creating a new **DataWriter** object and calling the **DataWriter.WriteString** method.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Lastly, add this code (within the inner using statement) to save the text to your file with **StoreAsync** and close the stream with **FlushAsync**.
segment.target: Lastly, add this code (within the inner using statement) to save the text to your file with **StoreAsync** and close the stream with **FlushAsync**.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Reading from a file
segment.target: Reading from a file

segment.source: Here's how to read from a file on disk using the **StorageFile** class.
segment.target: Here's how to read from a file on disk using the **StorageFile** class.

segment.source: The common first step for each of the ways of reading from a file is to get the file with **StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**.
segment.target: The common first step for each of the ways of reading from a file is to get the file with **StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Read text from your file by calling the **ReadTextAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.
segment.target: Read text from your file by calling the **ReadTextAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

source.pc: Reading bytes from a file by using a buffer (2 steps)

target.pc: Reading bytes from a file by using a buffer (2 steps)

segment.source: First, read bytes from your buffer to your file by calling the **ReadBufferAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.
segment.target: First, read bytes from your buffer to your file by calling the **ReadBufferAsync** method of the **FileIO** class.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Then use a **DataReader** object to read first the length of the buffer and then its contents.
segment.target: Then use a **DataReader** object to read first the length of the buffer and then its contents.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

source.pc: Reading text from a file by using a stream (4 steps)

target.pc: Reading text from a file by using a stream (4 steps)

segment.source: Open a stream for your file by calling the **StorageFile.OpenAsync** method.
segment.target: Open a stream for your file by calling the **StorageFile.OpenAsync** method.

segment.source: It returns a stream of the file's content when the operation completes.
segment.target: It returns a stream of the file's content when the operation completes.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Get the size of the stream to use later.
segment.target: Get the size of the stream to use later.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Get an input stream by calling the **GetInputStreamAt** method.
segment.target: Get an input stream by calling the **GetInputStreamAt** method.

segment.source: Put this in a using statement to manage the stream's lifetime.
segment.target: Put this in a using statement to manage the stream's lifetime.

segment.source: Specify 0 when you call GetInputStreamAt to set the position to the beginning of the stream.
segment.target: Specify 0 when you call GetInputStreamAt to set the position to the beginning of the stream.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Lastly, add this code within the existing using statement to get a **DataReader** object on the stream then read the text by calling **DataReader.LoadAsync** and **DataReader.ReadString**.
segment.target: Lastly, add this code within the existing using statement to get a **DataReader** object on the stream then read the text by calling **DataReader.LoadAsync** and **DataReader.ReadString**.

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
